subject: Re: [junit] How to identify a JavaCore failure ?
msgSnippet: ... A fourth way: Use Ant and the junit/batchtest task element to exclude entire TestCase classes. This doesn t work for individual tests defined in a
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> saji bekal wrote:
>
> > 2)Is there any way I can exclude some testcase from
> > a testsuite ?
>
> Three ways:
>
> 1. Create your own custom test suite by implementing the suite() method.
> 2. Change the name of the test by putting something like XXX in front of
> it. (Good temporary solution.)
> 3. Use JUnit-addons test runner and change the test name to
> test..._ignored(), so that the test runner will /not/ execute it, but
> still report that it was intentionally ignored, rather than
> unintentionally excluded.

A fourth way:

Use Ant and the junit/batchtest task element to exclude entire TestCase
classes. This doesn't work for individual tests defined in a TestCase.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
